newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Shell opens new Australian coal mine.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Shell opens new Australian coal mine.

text.p: Australia's newest coal mine, the A$330 million Dartbrook underground mine, was officially opened on Monday by the New South Wales (NSW) premier Bob Carr.
The mine, in NSW's Hunter Valley, will produce four million tonnes a year of thermal coal for the Asia-Pacific market.
During its projected life of 30 years, Dartbrook is expected to produce more than 100 million tonnes of high quality coal by longwall mining, major shareholder Shell Australia Ltd said.

Dartbrook is owned 75 percent by Shell Australia, 15 percent by Marubeni Corp's Marubeni Thermal Coal Pty Ltd, seven percent by the South Korea's Ssangyong Corp and three percent by Japan's Showa Mining Co Ltd. About 160 workers will be employed at the mine.
